content: when the chart is completed proceed to written instructions for round 7 knit into the front leg of the stitch then slip the back leg of the stitch w/o knitting knit yarn over purl if you need visual help with these 6 rounds watch part 1 of the let it snowflake tutorial https //youtu be/gvvsgmifdjk heart of a snowflake by elena maltseva july 2025 written instructions rounds 1-10 round 1 knit into the front leg of the stitch then slip the back leg of the stitch w/o knitting repeat 5 more times = 12 stitches total round 2 knit all stitches 12 stitches round 3 k1 yo2 k1 repeat 5 more times 24 stitches round 4 k1 knit the 1st yarn over purl the 2nd yarn over k1 repeat 5 more times 24 stitches round 5 k2 yo2 k2 repeat 5 more times 36 stitches round 6 k2 knit the 1st yarn over purl the 2nd yarn over k2 repeat 5 more times 36 stitches note knit round 7 with your circular needle round 7 *kfb leave the first kfb stitch on rh needle use the second kfb stitch and bo2 place your stitch back to lh needle kco2 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle kco2 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle kco2 bo4 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle k2tog * repeat the sequence from * to * 5 more times now slip the last stitch from rh needle onto your lh needle it is now the 1st stitch of the next round note only 12 live stitches will be left at the end of round 7 round 8 x *blco 8 x * repeat from * to * 4 more times finish the round with blco 8 60 stitches round 9 knit all stitches 60 stitches round 10 is a bind off round heart of a snowflake by elena maltseva july 2025 begin working the following sequence a tree point knitting into the first stitch on lh needle kco6 bo4 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle kco4 bo3 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle kco3 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle kco4 bo4 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle kco2 bo3 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle kco3 bo4 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle kco4 bo11 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle an arrows point knitting into the stitch on lh needle co7 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co2 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co2 bo4 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co4 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co2 bo2 slip the stitch from rh needle back to lh needle co2 bo4
